body_html: We have the op registry, but it only contains the C++ api, as well as the functions for gradients and shape inference. The closest we have for the python layer is the API docs, which is generated by scraping the source code, and therefore should always be up to date. This quickly turns icky, but you could actually get a reasonable snapshot by going through the python doc .md files and collecting headlines.

body: We have the op registry, but it only contains the C++ api, as well as the functions for gradients and shape inference. The closest we have for the python layer is the API docs, which is generated by scraping the source code, and therefore should always be up to date.
